metadata.title: CVE-2023-38559 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A buffer overflow flaw was found in base/gdevdevn.c:1973 indevn_pcx_write_rle() in ghostscript. This issue may allow a local attackerto cause a denial of service via outputting a crafted PDF file for a DEVNdevice with gs.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-38559` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ghostscript - 9.55.0~dfsg1-0ubuntu5.4
ghostscript-x - 9.55.0~dfsg1-0ubuntu5.4
libgs9 - 9.55.0~dfsg1-0ubuntu5.4
libgs9-common - 9.55.0~dfsg1-0ubuntu5.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ghostscript package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.55.0~dfsg1-0ubuntu5.4').
